THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
18.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

on
2024/KER/4123
CRL.MC_507/2024
2
BECHU KURIAN THOMAS, J
nmr
ORDER
Petitioner is the accused in S.C.No.378/2019 on the files of the
Additional Sessions Court-1, Kalpetta; alleging offence
punishable under Section 20(B)(ii)(b) of the Narcotcs Drugs and
Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985. Due to the failure of the
petitioner to appear before the trial court, the learned Sessions
Judge, on 29.11.2023, issued a non bailable warrant to the
accused and a notice to the sureties. Hence, this petition.

2. Smt.Reeha Khader K., the learned counsel for the petitioner,
submitted that the failure of the petitioner to appear before
the trial court is not willful and that he is willing to participate
in further postings without fail. However, petitioner
apprehends that he may be remanded to custody before
consideration of his application.

3. I have heard Smt.Sreeja V., the learned Public Prosecutor as

on
BE) ¢
2024/KER/4123
CRL.MC 507/2024
3
well.
4. Having regard to the circumstances of the case, especially since
it was submitted that the trial has practically been completed
and that what remains is only the final hearing; I am of the
view that a lenient view can be adopted.
5. Accordingly, there will be a direction to the learned Sessions
Judge to consider the application for recall of warrant and for
grant of bail, positively on the same day itself, provided such
applications are filed by the petitioner within ten days

BECHU KURIAN THOMAS, J
nmr
ORDER
Petitioner is the accused in S.C.No.378/2019 on the files of the
Additional Sessions Court-1, Kalpetta; alleging offence
punishable under Section 20(B)(ii)(b) of the Narcotcs Drugs and
Psychotropic Substances Act, 1985. Due to the failure of the
petitioner to appear before the trial court, the learned Sessions
Judge, on 29.11.2023, issued a non bailable warrant to the
accused and a notice to the sureties. Hence, this petition.

2. Smt.Reeha Khader K., the learned counsel for the petitioner,
submitted that the failure of the petitioner to appear before
the trial court is not willful and that he is willing to participate
in further postings without fail. However, petitioner
apprehends that he may be remanded to custody before
consideration of his application.

3. I have heard Smt.Sreeja V., the learned Public Prosecutor as

on
BE) ¢
2024/KER/4123
CRL.MC 507/2024
3
well.
4. Having regard to the circumstances of the case, especially since
it was submitted that the trial has practically been completed
and that what remains is only the final hearing; I am of the
view that a lenient view can be adopted.
5. Accordingly, there will be a direction to the learned Sessions
Judge to consider the application for recall of warrant and for
grant of bail, positively on the same day itself, provided such
applications are filed by the petitioner within ten days from
today.
The Crl.M.C.is disposed of.
